Not reproduced on my end - the site opens fine.
Try to leave only AdGuard filters, update them (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart the browser, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. comment.body:
@ihurin you can advise him to add these rules to the users rules.
```adblock
noxton.net#@#img[src*="counter.yadro.ru"]
@@||counter.yadro.ru/hit$image,domain=noxton.net
```
For the DNS module, this rule has to be added if he uses our DNS filter. Another option is to choose our non-filtered DNS.
```adblock
@@||counter.yadro.ru^|
```

### Comment
> Polyfill.io is blocked by AdGuard
> ---
> Polyfill.io is a service that provides code to emulate modern web features in older browsers, automatically detecting and loading only the necessary polyfills based on the user's browser. This allows web developers to ensure compatibility across diverse browser environments without manual configuration.
> 
> Blocking Polyfill.io can hinder the functionality of a website, potentially leading to a degraded user experience or inability for visitors to use the page or web app.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension, Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.57.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

www.qidian.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

_No response_

_No response_

_No response_

AdGuard DNS filter

AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. This script from Qidian consumes user's CPU and appears to provide no actual functionality. This slows down the user's browser. I suspect that this script is either a mining script or an anti-ad blocker measure. This is confirmed both on Firefox and Chromium.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29907700/c8efc467-80e1-4f8a-9810-e100f9975b72)

The script is obfuscated and makes a large number of recursive function calls. This can be confirmed using the browser's performance profiler.

</details>

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body: I placed the order from my MacBook Air, based on the amount indicated (in SEK), which I didn't select myself. The card I used for payment can handle that currency and others. After I had submitted the above issue, I got a flash message from the card provider that the requested payment was declined but not by the provider. On the provider's account page I can read that a corresponding amount in USD (79,99 USD to my surprise) had been charged (from Hong Kong), but the charge was declined. I think the issue is that no message explaining why the payment was declined was given, either with or without AdGuard.
